title: This Meyer Lemon & Honey Lassi Will Brighten Your Morning — Delicious Links
text:
(Image credit: Kitchen Confidante ) 
When you're smack-dab in the middle of winter — when the days are gray and the sun sets much too early — sometimes you need something cheery and bright to coax you out of your warm, cozy bed in the morning. Or perhaps you need a little pick-me-up when the 3 p.m. slump hits you hard and you feel like crawling under your desk for a nap. This lassi, which makes use of in-season Meyer lemon zest and juice, is definitely the right drink for the job. 
If you've never had the pleasure of drinking a lassi, you've really been missing out. We've featured several recipes on the site, including an avocado version, a strawberry version, a papaya-cardamom version, and a mango version. I think it's safe to say we are enamored of this simple drink. 
The Indian yogurt-based drink is thick, creamy, and refreshing. Because the ingredient list is so short — it only calls for four items — this is one of those recipes where you really want to use the best-quality ingredients you can get your hands on. You'll be rewarded with a filling, protein-rich treat. 
For this recipe you'll need plain yogurt, the zest and juice from about four Meyer lemons, honey, and ice cubes. That's it! You simply blend all the ingredients — including the ice, so make sure your blender is up to snuff — together before pouring into a glass. You can add extra ice cubes and garnish with a slice of Meyer lemon before diving in. 
One sip of this luscious glass of sunshine and you'll be able to tackle whatever winter throws your way. Shoveling your car out of the driveway? No problem. Taking your pup for a walk in sub-zero temperatures? Let's go, Fido!
